name: Lithium
summary: A classic mood stabilizer used for bipolar disorder, schizoaffective disorder, and augmentation in depression.
description: Lithium is an elemental mood stabilizer with anti-manic, anti-depressive, and anti-suicidal properties. It is primarily used in the management of bipolar disorder for both acute mania and maintenance therapy. Lithium also has evidence for reducing suicide risk and may be used as an augmentation strategy in major depressive disorder. Due to its narrow therapeutic index, serum levels must be closely monitored.

sections.text: Modulates neurotransmitter release and signal transduction, including inhibition of inositol monophosphatase, affecting second messenger systems.

adult.acute_mania: 600–900 mg/day in divided doses, titrated to serum level 0.8–1.2 mEq/L
adult.maintenance: 300–900 mg/day in divided doses, titrated to serum level 0.6–1.0 mEq/L

sections.geriatric: Lower initial dose and target serum level (0.4–0.8 mEq/L)
sections.renal_impairment: Avoid in severe impairment; dose adjustment required for moderate impairment

items: Lithium carbonate tablets: 150 mg, 300 mg, 600 mg
Lithium citrate oral solution: 8 mEq/5 mL

sections.text: Antimanic effect usually within 5–7 days; full effect may take 1–3 weeks.

sections.black_box: Lithium toxicity is closely related to serum concentrations and can occur at doses close to therapeutic levels.
other: Maintain consistent fluid and sodium intake
Caution in elderly due to increased risk of toxicity

items: Serum lithium level every 5–7 days after dose change, then every 3–6 months

sections.pregnancy: Category D; risk of Ebstein's anomaly in first trimester
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; generally not recommended
sections.geriatrics: Lower doses and closer monitoring recommended

sections.text: Gradual taper over at least 2–4 weeks to reduce relapse risk.

items: Reduces suicide risk independently of mood stabilization
Maintain hydration and stable sodium intake to avoid toxicity

seo.title: Lithium: Mood Stabilizer for Bipolar Disorder
seo.description: Lithium is a classic mood stabilizer used in bipolar disorder for acute mania and maintenance therapy, with proven anti-suicidal properties.
